reviews.review: A good game to drop a ton of time into it. Sometimes it's best played with buddies. Sometimes queuing solo is for the best. It has some long load times, but that depends on the day and such.

Un buen juego pero muy poco cuidado, cualquiera que sepa apretar el botòn izquierdo ya le gana a un killer de 5000 horas, te reparan 3 motores a la primera persecuciòn y de survivor te comes campeos y focuseos, que haya que saber jugar para ganar una partida y no solo apretar M1, en mi opiniòn habrìa que balancear màs el juego en vez de sacar skins y buffear killers que no lo necesitan.
De survivor te premian solo reparar y no entretener al asesino que es lo màs complicado de hacer, solo con estar escondido y reparar ya se rankea cuando el killer tiene que matar a los 4 y hacer muchas persecuciones entre màs cosas y aveces pasa de matar 3 y no rankear, muy injusto a mi parecer, cuando juego de survivor no reparo motores porque es aburrido que la partida se termine en 3 minutos solo con precionar un botòn y por supuesto no rankeo al escaparme y hago pocos puntos, cuando mis compañeros se van con 25k de puntos solo por andar escondidos y reparando, asì gana cualquiera y paso de seguir esas reglas, todavìa vacilan al killer cuando no aparecieron en todo el juego, deberìan incitar màs el saber jugar, muy buena la idea del juego pero le falta encaminar.

TL;DR: fun game, only one game mode (asymmetrical gameplay), toxic community (which can be easily avoided if you refuse to engage in the chatroom post-game) 

Alright, so I've played this game for hours on both console and pc and I really like it. I will say that starting off, if you only play as survivor it's going to feel like the killers are OP. They're not; I would suggest playing as both killer and survivor even if you only like playing as one. This way you'll see what the perspective is of the other side and you'll be able to learn what to do to avoid/counter your opponent(s). Playing as a killer a few times really helps you out in terms of figuring out how to avoid/counter them as survivors; and vice versa. When I was first starting off I was dying over and over like crazy but now I play fairly well. I'm not a pro or anything, but I do alright. Just be patient because there is a slight learning curve.
There is only one game mode, you repair 5 generators (there are numerous maps and they're procedurally generated, so the locations of the items/generators will be different each time you play to a certain extent). After the generators are repaired you escape by opening a door. If you're the last person in the game or have an item, you can escape through a hatch that's randomly placed somewhere on the map.
Some people play the survivors who are trying to escape (a team of 4 survivors) and another person plays the killer who simply uses his/her abilities to prevent the survivors from escaping. The killer mainly tries to hook the survivors which locks them in place.
There are multiple killers and survivors and you can level them up to give them perks and items to use in game. There's also items that can be burned to take you to a specific map or give you bonus xp etc.
Now the community is super toxic, so I would just avoid talking to people in-game at all costs. Survivors are toxic when the killer wins and vice versa.
Story to let you guys know what I mean by toxic. I never level up my killers, I really only play survivor and I'll jump in as killers once in a while just to get some bonus challenges done for xp etc. So my huntress (one of the killers you can choose from) is level 1 and only has 1 perk equipped (the max you can equip is 4) nothing else, no items no nothing, I literally haven't even touched her levelup tree. I lose the match, but I was trying. Going after survivors etc. Hooking them, throwing axes at them, normal Huntress things. I lose and all the survivors escape, nbd. In the end-game chat one of the survivors celebrates and says something like "Yeah let's get that w!" and other celebratory comments which is completely cool. I respond with "lol gg" and then he tells me that "You're mad because you suck" and all these other things, and I'm like: "how am I mad" all I said was gg... He then proceeds to tell me that I should quit the game and play fornite because I suck so bad... It's like dude win with some class. The funny thing is that he was equipped with all these great perks that made his character more viable and even though he knows i'm playing a lvl 1 character he tells me I suck and need to quit "his" game? ... really? But I learned my lesson and I'm just not going to interact with the trash. I really recommend you do the same.
A lot of the time as killer you'll get the survivors complaining when you camp etc. Just do your own thing. I will say that I try not to camp even when I'm going for challenges as killer because it doens't make the game fun. Moving around and chasing people is what makes this game fun. However, if the devs wanted to eliminate camping as a strategy they would find a way to punish killers that camp. If the devs didn't want the killer focusing on only one survivor at a time they would find a way to force the killer to focus on different survivors. If the killer is just playing the game and not using exploits or whatever, it's legitimate. When I'm a survivor and a killer is camping, I just keep repairing generators; if the killer is camping and 2-3 generators get activated, he's going to stop camping quick because he's about to lose if he doesn't start moving around the map. It sucks, but I don't whine like a baby in game-chat post game.
This game is far from perfect, I think it would be a lot of fun if they introduced different game types as well.
Having said all of that though, it is really fun and enjoyable if you take it for what it is: a videogame.

一个比较尴尬的问题 低分段选择杀手的人太多然而一局是一个杀手和四名人类也就是说比例是一比四 而低分段选择杀手的人太多就导致了低分段选择杀手进行匹配速度非常慢而这个游戏只有排位模式这一种模式没有休闲你打的每一局都会对你的分数有影响  还是建议出一个休闲的模式让各个分段的人都可以加入的那种
